title: Copynumber
text: addition sample methylation data, conumee requires methylation data control samples flat genome. reference data kindly provided Dr. Martin Sill DKFZ. Furthermore, annotation object passed conumee tells package genomic regions evaluated. means annotation object, number detail regions can specified dedicated copy number values computed. study, gene loci covered least 20 CpG probes EPIC array specified detail regions. Since different annotation reference objects used male female samples, information patient sex required. contained patientsheet. Load samplesheet patientsheet:
code: samplesheet <- read.csv("~/sfb824/packagepdgfra_input/samplesheet.csv") samplesheet %>% head() #>   sample_id patient_id                                       idat_location #> 1   sfb01_1      sfb01 ~/data/methylation_data/Pat01.1/202212330261_R07C01 #> 2   sfb01_2      sfb01 ~/data/methylation_data/Pat01.2/202242420132_R07C01 #> 3   sfb01_3      sfb01 ~/data/methylation_data/Pat01.3/202212330261_R06C01 #> 4   sfb02_1      sfb02 ~/data/methylation_data/Pat02.1/202242420132_R02C01 #> 5   sfb02_2      sfb02 ~/data/methylation_data/Pat02.2/202242420132_R06C01 #> 6   sfb02_3      sfb02 ~/data/methylation_data/Pat02.3/202242420132_R01C01 #>   project #> 1  SFB824 #> 2  SFB824 #> 3  SFB824 #> 4  SFB824 #> 5  SFB824 #> 6  SFB824 patientsheet <- read.csv(file.path(inputDir, "patientsheet.csv")) patientsheet %>% head() #>   patient_id n_samples sex age #> 1 GU-HGG-154         4   m  NA #> 2 GU-HGG-182         3   m  NA #> 3 GU-HGG-185         3   m  NA #> 4 GU-HGG-200         3   f  NA #> 5 GU-HGG-204         3   f  NA #> 6 GU-HGG-216         3   f  NA

title: Copynumber
text: conumee annotation object can generated specifying start stop coordinates genomic regions detailed output desired. start stop coordinates detail regions extracted EPIC probes annotation. codeblock groups probes associated genes extracts positions first last probe given gene. many probes per gene?  Keep genes least 20 probes coverage: Overall, 12,724 genetic loci included detail regions object. Check regions Martin Sill’s annotation object also contained: Five genomic regions contained, added manually. Store GRanges object later use: Finally, conumee annotation object can generated taking previously created detail regions object input. Two versions computed, one without sex chromosomes. Save :
code: library(minfi) library(conumee) library(IlluminaHumanMethylationEPICanno.ilm10b4.hg19) annoEpic <- getAnnotation(IlluminaHumanMethylationEPICanno.ilm10b4.hg19) %>%    as.data.frame() genesEpic <- annoEpic %>%    dplyr::filter(UCSC_RefGene_Name != "") %>%    dplyr::mutate(gene = stringr::str_split(UCSC_RefGene_Name, ";")) %>%    tidyr::unnest(cols = c(gene)) %>%    dplyr::group_by(chr, gene) %>%    dplyr::summarise(from = min(pos),                    to = max(pos),                    n_probes = length(unique(Name)),                    contexts = paste(unique(unlist(stringr::str_split(UCSC_RefGene_Group, ";"))), collapse = ";"),                    .groups = "drop") genesEpic %>% head() #> # A tibble: 6 × 6 #>   chr   gene         from        to n_probes contexts                            #>   <chr> <chr>       <int>     <int>    <int> <chr>                               #> 1 chr1  A3GALT2  33776046  33787381       12 Body;TSS200;TSS1500                 #> 2 chr1  AADACL3  12774815  12787380       12 Body;5'UTR;1stExon;TSS200;TSS1500;… #> 3 chr1  AADACL4  12703392  12727093       17 TSS1500;Body;1stExon;TSS200;3'UTR   #> 4 chr1  ABCA4    94458645  94587905       75 TSS1500;1stExon;5'UTR;Body;ExonBnd… #> 5 chr1  ABCB10  229655141 229695511       27 TSS1500;TSS200;Body                 #> 6 chr1  ABCD3    94882585  94983186       24 TSS1500;1stExon;Body;TSS200;3'UTR;… library(ggplot2) ggplot(genesEpic, aes(x = n_probes)) +    geom_histogram(binwidth = 1) +    intratumormeth_theme() minProbesPerGene <- 20  detailGenes <- genesEpic %>%    dplyr::filter(n_probes >= minProbesPerGene) %>%    # rename potentially duplicate names by adding the chromosome as a suffix   dplyr::mutate(gene = dplyr::case_when(gene %in% .$gene[duplicated(.$gene)] ~ paste0(gene, "_", chr),                           TRUE ~ gene))  detailRegions <- GenomicRanges::GRanges(seqnames = detailGenes$chr,                          ranges = IRanges::IRanges(start = detailGenes$from, end = detailGenes$to),                          name = detailGenes$gene,                          # thick specifies the plotting window for detail plots                          thick = IRanges::IRanges(start = detailGenes$from - 5000, end = detailGenes$to + 5000),                          seqinfo = GenomeInfoDb::Seqinfo(genome = "hg19")) detailRegions #> GRanges object with 12724 ranges and 2 metadata columns: #>           seqnames              ranges strand |        name               thick #>              <Rle>           <IRanges>  <Rle> | <character>           <IRanges> #>       [1]     chr1   94458645-94587905      * |       ABCA4   94453645-94592905 #>       [2]     chr1 229655141-229695511      * |      ABCB10 229650141-229700511 #>       [3]     chr1   94882585-94983186      * |       ABCD3   94877585-94988186 #>       [4]     chr1 179069967-179200312      * |        ABL2 179064967-179205312 #>       [5]     chr1   76188832-76215992      * |       ACADM   76183832-76220992 #>       ...      ...                 ...    ... .         ...                 ... #>   [12720]     chrX 134419896-134479169      * |      ZNF75D 134414896-134484169 #>   [12721]     chrY   16634027-16945913      * |      NLGN4Y   16629027-16950913 #>   [12722]     chrY     9194502-9366496      * |       TSPY4     9189502-9371496 #>   [12723]     chrY   21154291-21240028      * |      TTTY14   21149291-21245028 #>   [12724]     chrY     2802103-2844835      * |         ZFY     2797103-2849835 #>   ------- #>   seqinfo: 298 sequences (2 circular) from hg19 genome # this object has name 'anno' load("~/data/cnv_ref/CNanalysis4_conumee_ANNO.vh20150715.RData")  # show detail region names not contained in my detail regions anno@detail[!anno@detail$name %in% detailRegions$name, ] #> GRanges object with 5 ranges and 2 metadata columns: #>       seqnames              ranges strand |          name               thick #>          <Rle>           <IRanges>  <Rle> |   <character>           <IRanges> #>   [1]     chr4     1739326-1808410      * |   FGFR3/TACC3     1239326-2308410 #>   [2]     chr7 138552722-140487384      * | KIAA1549/BRAF 138052722-140987384 #>   [3]     chr8   38279316-38688695      * |   FGFR1/TACC1   37779316-39188695 #>   [4]     chr9   21967751-22014312      * |      CDKN2A/B   21467751-22514312 #>   [5]    chr19   54164928-54265684      * |         C19MC   53664928-54765684 #>   ------- #>   seqinfo: 22 sequences from an unspecified genome  # add those genetic loci to my detail regions detailRegions <- c(detailRegions, anno@detail[!anno@detail$name %in% detailRegions$name, ]) # check: anno@detail[!anno@detail$name %in% detailRegions$name, ] #> GRanges object with 0 ranges and 2 metadata columns: #>    seqnames    ranges strand |        name     thick #>       <Rle> <IRanges>  <Rle> | <character> <IRanges> #>   ------- #>   seqinfo: 22 sequences from an unspecified genome dir.create(file.path(outputDir, "copynumber")) saveRDS(detailRegions, file.path(outputDir, "copynumber", "cnv_detailregions_granges.Rdata")) detailRegionsNoXy <- detailRegions[!(seqnames(detailRegions) %in% c("chrX", "chrY"))]  cnvAnnoEpicXY <- CNV.create_anno(array_type = "EPIC", chrXY = TRUE, detail_regions = detailRegions) cnvAnnoEpic <- CNV.create_anno(array_type = "EPIC", chrXY = FALSE, detail_regions = detailRegionsNoXy) saveRDS(cnvAnnoEpic, file.path(outputDir, "copynumber", "conumee_annotation_epic.Rdata")) saveRDS(cnvAnnoEpicXY, file.path(outputDir, "copynumber", "conumee_annotation_epic_xy.Rdata"))

title: Copynumber
text: Load annotation data created : Load reference data required conumee: Now inputs prepared can run conumee: writes CNV.analysis object sample specified output directory. Since objects contain lot data extract important information decrease load times later analysis.
code: annoF <- readRDS(file.path(inputDir, "conumee", "conumee_annotation_epic.Rdata")) annoM <- readRDS(file.path(inputDir, "conumee", "conumee_annotation_epic_xy.Rdata")) annoF #> CNV annotation object #>    created  : Mon Nov 29 11:44:40 2021 #>   @genome   : 22 chromosomes #>   @gap      : 313 regions #>   @probes   : 844316 probes #>   @exclude  : 0 regions (overlapping 0 probes) #>   @detail   : 12443 regions (overlapping 639803 probes) #>   @bins     : 25752 bins (min/avg/max size: 50/103.8/5000kb, probes: 15/32.8/437) refF <- readRDS(file.path(inputDir, "conumee", "conumee_ref_epic_F_Sill.Rdata")) refM <- readRDS(file.path(inputDir, "conumee", "conumee_ref_epic_M_Sill.Rdata")) refM #> CNV data object #>    created   :  #>   @intensity : available (50 samples, 865859 probes) run_conumee(outputDir, samplesheet, patientsheet, refF, refM, annoF, annoM)

title: Preprocessing
text: vignette shows preprocessing workflow used analyze raw IDAT files Illumina HumanMethylationEPIC microarrays. reading intensity levels, following steps performed: calculate detection p-values based control probes using minfi::detectionP(), conversion intensity levels methylation beta-values M-values using minfi::preprocessRaw(), minfi::preprocessSWAN(), minfi::preprocessNoob(), minfi::preprocessQuantile(). resulting data saved specified output directory. first preprocessing step, methylation data can obtained using function get_beta() allows specify normalization method, well probe filter sample filter. Probe filtering suggested repeatedly literature since array probes found yield non-reproducible results due targeting SNPs instead methylation, non-unique binding sequences -target hybridization (Zhou, Laird, Shen 2016; Pidsley et al. 2016).

title: Preprocessing
text: run preprocessing workflow, samplesheet dataframe prepared associates given sample id location corresponding IDAT files. one green one red channel IDAT file sample can distinguished file name suffix (e.g. filename_Red.idat filename_Grn.idat). Column idat_location contain filename without red/green suffix. Since intratumor heterogeneity study, individual samples furthermore associated corresponding patients. patient id corresponding given sample specified column patient_id. Additionally, arbitrary sample-wise metadata can specified columns samplesheet (take care name ambiguously). exemplary samplesheet shown : samplesheet contains 213 samples 46 patients SFB824 project B12, well 47 samples 15 patients dataset published Wenger et al. (2019) (GEO accession: GSE116298)

title: Preprocessing
text: Now required data prepared actual preprocessing can begin. able render vignette faster, 10 sample subset data processed. finished, generated data can obtained like : starting analysis methylation levels, quality control step performed order detect samples poor quality (.e. high average detection p-value) filter probes associated low reproducibility (Zhou, Laird, Shen 2016; Pidsley et al. 2016). See vignette quality_control details.
code: preprocess_methylation_data(samplesheet, outputDir = "~/sfb824/packagepdgfra_output/") betas <- get_betas(outputDir = "~/sfb824/packagepdgfra_output/",                     normalization = "swan",                     removeNaProbes = TRUE,                    probeFilter = NULL,                    sampleFilter = NULL) betas[1:5,1:5]

title: Quality Control
text: EPIC microarray employs set control probes can evaluated quantify confidence obtained methylation levels individual probes. values called detection p-values. Samples high average detection p-value excluded study, well probes fail multiple samples. returns list object contains four members: samples average detection p-value higher 0.01 therefore excluded analysis. Next, number individual probes failing given sample investigated. can seen function output, quite poor-quality beta values dataset. distributed across many probes, excluding respective probes samples option since remove almost 500,000 CpG methylation levels case. list probes fail one samples returned: almost 500,000 probes poor detection p-value least one sample. majority probes fails just one two samples, consistently fail: study, probes fail three samples excluded, well samples average detection p-value greater 0.01. corresponding sample probe ids stored disk order later use filters loading methylation beta values.
code: # outputDir contains data previously generated by preprocess_methylation_data() detP <- detection_p_analysis(outputDir,                               pThreshold = 0.01) detP$poorSamplePlot detP$meanDetP %>%    dplyr::filter(mean_detp > 0.01) detP$failingProbes %>% head() nrow(detP$failingProbes) detP$failingProbesPlot probeFilter <- detP$failingProbes$probe_id[detP$failingProbes$failed_in_n_samples > 3] length(probeFilter) sampleFilter <- detP$meanDetP[["sample_id"]][detP$meanDetP$mean_detp > 0.01]  # save these filters for later use: # saveRDS(probeFilter, file.path(inputDir, "probe_filter.Rdata")) # saveRDS(sampleFilter, file.path(inputDir, "sample_filter.Rdata"))

title: Quality Control
text: Comparing difference intensities obtained probes targeting sex chromosomes reveals clusters male female samples. feature can used predict sex respective sample. list contains three ggplot objects tibble predicted sex. Compare predicted sex actual sex filter cases predicted sex match actual sex: sample sfb18_1, predicted actual sex deviate, can example indicate poor sample preparation sample mislabeling.
code: predictedSex <- predict_sex(outputDir, normalization = "swan", predictionCutoff = -2) predictedSex$chrX predictedSex$chrY predictedSex$cutoff predictedSex$predicted_sex %>%    head() patientsheet <- read.csv(file.path(inputDir, "patientsheet.csv")) samplesheet %>% dplyr::left_join(patientsheet, by = "patient_id") %>%   dplyr::left_join(predictedSex$predicted_sex, by = "sample_id") %>%    dplyr::filter(predicted_sex != sex)

text: Every stage workflow described separate vignette: preprocessing: read IDAT files, extract methylation values quality_control: investigate detection p-values, tumor purity, find poor quality samples probes copynumber: run conumee generate CNV data classification: evaluate glioma subtype MGMT promoter methylation dimensionality_reduction: perform PCA t-SNE find clusters phylogeny: run TuMult separate CNV data

title: Get Methylation Beta Values — get_betas
text: Loads previously generated methylation beta values disk retuns matrix. function allows specify probe sample filters. specified character vectors containing probe/sample ids. Furthermore, normalization method can specified. Probes contain NA values can removed samples specifying removeNaProbes = TRUE.

title: Get Methylation Beta Values — get_betas
code: get_betas(   outputDir,   probeFilter = NULL,   sampleFilter = NULL,   normalization = "raw",   removeNaProbes = FALSE )

title: Get Methylation Beta Values — get_betas
text: outputDir Output directory intratumormeth study. probeFilter Character vector containing probe ids filtered . sampleFilter Character vector containing sample ids filtered . normalization either "raw", "noob", "swan". removeNaProbes TRUE, beta values probes NA least one sample removed.
